original: Almquist, Einar Gustaf, vägdirektör, civilingenjör, kapten VVK, Lin-’köping, f. 8/9/93 på Han&tavik i Södertälje ilanidsförs., Sthlms 1., av major Carl Gustaf A. o. Anna Albertina Almgren. G. 1. 26-37 m. Carin Paltm-quist; 2. 41 m. Ellen Bratt. Barn: Carin (Carina) f. 27. — Stud :ex. v. nya ’el’em::sk. i Sthlm 12, avg:- ex. fr. KTH (V) 17, off:ex. v. VVK 17, ikapten 30. Sttip:res. t. USA o. Enigd. f. väg- o. ibrois’tud’. 23- 24, kort. stud:res. t. Danm., Finl., N’orge, Tyskl. Ing. i ing:firman Kreuger & Linton 18-20, v. järnvägs-styr. nybyggn :avd. 20, ing. o. byrå-ing. h. väg- o. vatten,byggn :styr. 21-29, stat. väging. i Örebro 1. 30-38, väg-inspektör h. väg- o. vattenbyggn :styr. 39-46, överinspektör där 46, vägdirektör i östergötl. 1. fr. 46. Lär. v. Sv. vägfören. vägmäst :kurser m. m. 25-44. Sekr. i Sv. tekn :fören. avd. f. väg- o. vattenb:konst 29-30, i Örebro 1. väg-styr :fÖTen. 31-38. Skr.: art. i väg-fråg. i bl. a. Tekn. tidskr. o. Sv. vägfören. tidskr. RVO 39, skytteGm.
translated: Almquist, Einar Gustaf, Road Director, Civil Engineer, Captain of the Swedish Naval Corps, from Lin-köping. Born September 8, 1893 in Han-tavik, Södertälje parish, Stockholm County, son of Major Carl Gustaf A. and Anna Albertina Almgren. Married 1st in 1926 to Carin Paltmquist, and 2nd in 1941 to Ellen Bratt. Children: Carin (Carina) b. 1927. Graduated from Nya Elementarskolan in Stockholm in 1912. Received a degree in civil engineering from the Royal Institute of Technology (KTH) in 1917, and became an officer of the Swedish Naval Corps in 1917, promoted to Captain in 1930. Received a scholarship for road and bridge engineering in the USA and the UK in 1923-1924 and studied briefly in Denmark, Finland, Norway, and Germany. Worked as an engineer for Kreuger & Linton from 1918 to 1920, and worked in the railway construction department from 1920. Served as an engineer and bureau engineer for the road and water construction authority from 1921 to 1929. Served as a state road engineer in Örebro County from 1930 to 1938 and as a road inspector in the road and water construction authority from 1939 to 1946, becoming chief inspector in 1946. Became Road Director of Östergötland County in 1946. Taught at Swedish Road Association roadmaster courses from 1925 to 1944. Secretary of the Swedish Technical Association road and water engineering department from 1929 to 1930 and of the Örebro County road authority from 1931 to 1938. Wrote articles on road issues in, among others, Teknisk Tidskrift and the Swedish Road Association's journal (Sv. vägfören. tidskr.). Recipient of the Royal Medal of the 8th size with the ribbon of the Order of the Sword.

award.name: Royal Medal of the 8th size with the ribbon of the Order of the Sword
